line_1: Those truths which neither use nor years impair,
line_2: Invite thee, wooe thee, to the bliss they share.

line_1: Say, shall her lustre death itself impair?
line_2: When in high noon she rides, then sets in dark despair?

line_1: Whose solid, grandeur time could not impair.
line_2: To his high dome Eugenio led the fair:

line_1: " Restores with art what accidents impair,
True Comeliness, which nothing can impair,
line_2: Gross he who judges so. His Soul was fair,

line_1: True Comeliness, which nothing can impair,
line_2: Dwells in the Mind: all else is Vanity and Glare.

line_1: Did the true Charms of Majesty impair:
line_2: Show'd sad Remains of what had once been fair;

line_1: I seem (delusions thus my mind impair)
line_2: Bursts into sound, and floats upon the air,

line_1: I seem (delusions thus my mind impair)
line_2: Mingling discordant strains of deep despair.

line_1: I seem (delusions thus my mind impair)
line_2: Distracting thoughts upon my spirit pour,
Can years make Virtue look less fair?
